reviews.review_msg: Alex is by far one of the most outstanding professor's I've taken a class with at SFU.  He's an experienced teacher who knows how to guide a class that relies mostly on thought processes & discussion.   He's well versed with past & current issues facing Latin America & has a broader perspective of understanding history itself.  A very kind man.

Alec is the dean of our department so I was surprised he took the time out to teach a tiny class of undergrads. He really cares about you and classes are more of a conversation than a lecture. Great feedback on written work. I learned so much just from talking with him and about how to look at how we learn. Very insightful and unique class.

Professor Dawson is awesome! great lecturer always interesting and shows great interest in the subject matter.  His book is well written as well.  He has to cover an immense topic in this class that is why he sometimes seems to be all over the place.

dawson teaches good topics and really opens up your views of latin america. however, his lectures are all over the place, you need to rely heavily on the text for information. also try and take the 208 course because he assumes you have when he is lecturing.

This guy is a good prof, 3 essays + tutorials make 70% of your grade, so if you're good at writing then you'll do good. Marking is up to the T.A. not him. Lecture was very interesting however if you spent time doing the essays thats your grade. Final review session covered topics on final, final was also an essay!!! -_-, writing course!.

1) Needs to relax a bit on the grading 2) Has to understand that other people have different opinions to his own 3) Could write some comments on work that he has graded 4) Has to cut back on the number of novels he assigns students to read. This is not an english class 5) I do like the fact that he did not use a textbook

Grading is a little on the hard side. It's good he just does not teach out of a textbook, but he makes you by 6 of the most boarding novels I have ever read. His lectures manage to keep the class awake, but the tutorials are easy to sleep through.

Very good prof.  Really interested in material.  Course was decent, but I wish he could have given us a textbook for basic reference stuff since most people in the class knew very little of Latin America.  He concentrates on pictures/monographs a lot - but he does convey a good message, coherent, and gives his own EXCELLENT insight.

He was interesting and I liked him. However, some people in the class disagreed with me. Well in tutorials, he was always scratching his......... uh...... you know what I mean. Well didn't notice that myself until somebody told me. Would like to take another class with him though. Strong obsession for Donald Duck and the Gaucho

Interesting material! He demands too much on discussion papers - tells you your work is too "simple." If you ask how he wants you to write, he'll tell you to write like NY Journalists(?). Has strong opinions and in class attacks you if you disagree with him. Wont stop until he wins.
Interesting lecutures. Very Fair exams, but expects way too in your papers. Likes ridiculous facts. Strange guy.
He is always sick, yet toughs it out, so give him points for that.  Presents Latin American history from a very balanced viewpoint.

An enjoyable class. He's quite lenient when it comes to marking. The class consisted of 4 quizzes, a take-home mid-term and a final. The only problem someone might have is that his accent can be difficult to understand, other wise he's great. Tutorial is very crucial and will help you a lot. Expect readings every week and keep up with them!
